info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:02AM CDT until July 06 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR WESTERN TEXAS AND EASTERN CIMARRON COUNTIES... At 201 AM CDT, automated weather equipment reported a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Boise City, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. At 155 AM CDT, a 71 mph wind gust recorded at Boise City. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Guymon, Boise City, Goodwell, Texhoma, Keyes, Eva, Griggs and Sturgis. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
